timeline.message:
Introduce new `DisplayNameGenerator` named `Simple`

This new generator extends `Standard` and removes parenthesis
at the end of method names if they have no parameters.

Resolves #1961.

replies.bodyText:
I was actually wondering whether to put it or not.
I originally added it in ReplaceUnderscores to make some_test(Object o) become some test (Object) which looks better imo.
But here if Simple is used in Kotlin (I know it’s not dedicated to Kotlin usage but it was the purpose of the original request and I guess most people will use it for that), it will display such method as some test(Object) if there is no extra space, which I find less pretty (I might be nitpicking here).
What do you think?
replies.author: juliette-derancourt

replies.bodyText: I think that's a fair point, I hadn't thought of that. 👍
